intro: Callicarpa giraldii var. chinyunensis, commonly known as the Chinyun Beauty or Chinese beautyberry, is a deciduous shrub native to China. It belongs to the honeysuckle family (Caprifoliaceae) and is characterized by its clusters of vibrant purple to red berries that appear in late summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 1–3 meters and features opposite, ovate leaves with serrated edges. Its ornamental value lies primarily in its striking berries, which are edible but often used in traditional medicine. It thrives in partial shade to full sun and prefers well-drained soil.
